text.__SUMMARY__: Atractaspis boulengeri, or the Central African burrowing asp, is a species of venomous snake in the family Atractaspididae. The species is endemic to Africa.
text.Etymology: The specific epithet, boulengeri, is in honor of Belgian-British herpetologist George Albert Boulenger.
text.Further reading: Mocquard F (1897). "Sur une collection de Reptiles recueillis par M. Haug, à Lambaréné ". Bulletin de la Société Philomathique de Paris, Huitième Série [Eighth Series] 9: 5-20. (Atractaspis boulengeri, new species, pp. 16–17). (in French).
